items.content_html: Back in Ohio after several weeks away in Belgium and North Carolina. Kid back in school tomorrow. There’s lots of client work to catch up on, but I can feel the space for returning to personal projects approaching.
items.content_text: Back in Ohio after several weeks away in Belgium and North Carolina. Kid back in school tomorrow. There’s lots of client work to catch up on, but I can feel the space for returning to personal projects approaching.

items.content_html: Pulled out Jesse Grosjean’s Bike Outliner this morning to untangle a cascade of feature feedback/questions and to organize my answers.
items.content_text: Pulled out Jesse Grosjean’s [Bike Outliner](https://www.hogbaysoftware.com/bike/) this morning to untangle a cascade of feature feedback/questions and to organize my answers.

items.content_html: Very intrigued by Ben Brown’s Shuttlecraft project, but have to resist the temptation to fiddle in order to stick with my pile of other unfinished personal projects.
items.content_text: Very intrigued by Ben Brown’s [Shuttlecraft](https://shuttlecraft.net/) project, but have to resist the temptation to fiddle in order to stick with my pile of other unfinished personal projects.

items.content_html: Lovely feeling to wake up to the first day of date-sensitive presentation code working as it should on its own.
items.content_text: Lovely feeling to wake up to the first day of date-sensitive presentation code working as it should on its own.

items.content_html: Screensharing on my basement server in Ohio from Belgium to confirm that the power is still on there, and that therefore we still have heat, and that therefore hopefully no pipes have frozen.
items.content_text: Screensharing on my basement server in Ohio from Belgium to confirm that the power is still on there, and that therefore we still have heat, and that therefore hopefully no pipes have frozen.

items.content_html: Went to the exhibit of Lucie Kamuswekera’s embroidery at the Ambsab social history museum in Gent yesterday. Got to see two of the pieces Sarah bought when she was last in Congo in the flesh for the first time and took a photo.
items.content_text: Went to the [exhibit](https://www.amsab.be/en/over-ons/nieuws/1085-expo-lucie-kamuswekera-geborduurd-verleden-verbeelde-toekomst) of Lucie Kamuswekera’s embroidery at the Ambsab social history museum in Gent yesterday. Got to see two of the pieces Sarah bought when she was last in Congo in the flesh for the first time and took a photo.

items.content_html: Sitting in the pithiness of Alan Jacobs’s notion of the past as “our always-available counterculture” all morning.
items.content_text: Sitting in the pithiness of Alan Jacobs’s notion of the past as “[our always-available counterculture](https://blog.ayjay.org/42391-2/)” all morning.

items.content_html: The updates on Nova keep coming just as I’ve become sick enough of a bug that I’m ready to submit a report myself. Perfect timing.
items.content_text: The updates on [Nova](https://nova.app/) keep coming just as I’ve become sick enough of a bug that I’m ready to submit a report myself. Perfect timing.

items.content_html: Covered in frozen mist in Belgium and doing some digital housekeeping for the first time in a long time. Impressed by much DEVONthink has evolved since I last really pushed my understanding of it.
items.content_text: Covered in frozen mist in Belgium and doing some digital housekeeping for the first time in a long time. Impressed by much DEVONthink has evolved since I last really pushed my understanding of it.

items.content_html: Just noticed I posted over a year ago that I was working on redoing my personal site in Astro. I still am.
items.content_text: Just noticed I posted over a year ago that I was working on redoing my personal site in Astro. I still am.

items.content_html: Found ‘Feliz Navidad from Freddy Fender’ on vinyl at Twist and Shout in Denver a couple of years ago. It’s now in top holiday season rotation. m.youtube.com/watch
items.content_text: Found ‘Feliz Navidad from Freddy Fender’ on vinyl at Twist and Shout in Denver a couple of years ago. It’s now in top holiday season rotation. [m.youtube.com/watch](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=Q8Lhh2aZkf8)

items.content_html: Taking the opportunity of a new laptop to get into using Warp as my terminal and am impressed with a lot of the new interface thinking. Little imperfections stand out strongly in the context of my experience with iTerm which is so rock-solid, but think the creativity may be worth the friction.
items.content_text: Taking the opportunity of a new laptop to get into using [Warp](https://warp.dev) as my terminal and am impressed with a lot of the new interface thinking. Little imperfections stand out strongly in the context of my experience with iTerm which is so rock-solid, but think the creativity may be worth the friction.

items.content_html: Pretty stoked on the new index we added to Public Domain Review today.
items.content_text: Pretty stoked on the new [index](https://publicdomainreview.org/explore/indexed) we added to Public Domain Review today.

items.content_html: Visiting State College, PA this morning, getting ready for the Nittany Valley Half-Marathon, my first organized race in over three years after COVID closures and series of injuries.
items.content_text: Visiting State College, PA this morning, getting ready for the Nittany Valley Half-Marathon, my first organized race in over three years after COVID closures and series of injuries.

items.content_html: I want every single pair of these vintage Patagonia baggies with bootleg logo and pattern embroidery petrifiedgood.org
items.content_text: I want every single pair of these vintage Patagonia baggies with bootleg logo and pattern embroidery [petrifiedgood.org](https://petrifiedgood.org/)

items.content_html: Have really been enjoying getting into petite-vue for a little progressive enhancement on some client work this weekend. Nice to be able to use the reactivity mental model of Vue without a full app framework.
items.content_text: Have really been enjoying getting into [petite-vue](https://github.com/vuejs/petite-vue) for a little progressive enhancement on some client work this weekend. Nice to be able to use the reactivity mental model of Vue without a full app framework.

items.content_html: Stoked on this Kerry Awn illustration we commissioned for Local Memory, which I’ve finally gotten on the homepage.
items.content_text: Stoked on this Kerry Awn illustration we commissioned for [Local Memory](https://local-memory.org), which I’ve finally gotten on the homepage.

items.content_html: Heartened by Flickr’s response to the removal of the Internet Archive Book Images collection. Hope that the details all work out well, but the direction of the reaction is definitely encouraging. Well done.
items.content_text: Heartened by [Flickr’s response](https://www.flickr.com/help/forum/en-us/72157720510495566/#reply72157720613909345) to the removal of the Internet Archive Book Images collection. Hope that the details all work out well, but the direction of the reaction is definitely encouraging. Well done.

items.content_html: Flickr has deleted over 5 million book scan images associated with the Internet Archive Book Images collection and their related user-contributed metadata. Consider signing an open letter asking that Flickr reconsider its decision.
items.content_text: Flickr has deleted over 5 million book scan images associated with the Internet Archive Book Images collection and their related user-contributed metadata. [Consider signing an open letter](https://publicdomainreview.org/blog/2022/04/5-million-book-illustrations-deleted-from-flickr) asking that Flickr reconsider its decision.

items.content_html: The always great BBSP theorizes the U.G.H.Z. (Un-Grammable Hang Zone), an aesthetic fixation of mine I have always struggled to articulate. Kafé Kerouac is my favorite local U.G.H.Z. I’m always on the lookout in new towns, but they are harder and harder to find.
items.content_text: The always great BBSP theorizes the [U.G.H.Z. (Un-Grammable Hang Zone)](https://www.blackbirdspyplane.com/p/un-grammable-hang-zone-manifesto), an aesthetic fixation of mine I have always struggled to articulate. Kafé Kerouac is my favorite local U.G.H.Z. I’m always on the lookout in new towns, but they are harder and harder to find.

items.content_html: If I see a cassette cover with a Bodys Isek Kingelez installation come through my email, you have my attention. If your promo copy then namechecks DJ Screw, I’m in. I had heard a bit of La Roche, but this new one from Nyege Nyege Tapes is revelatory.
items.content_text: If I see a cassette cover with a Bodys Isek Kingelez installation come through my email, you have my attention. If your promo copy then namechecks DJ Screw, I’m in. I had heard a bit of La Roche, but this [new one](https://nyegenyegetapes.bandcamp.com/album/liye-liye) from Nyege Nyege Tapes is revelatory.

items.content_text: Daily meeting with the homies

items.content_text: The frost on today’s morning walk was wild.

items.content_html: Started experimenting with rebuilding my personal website (untouched through the COVID era) with Astro. Already excited to see much better it could be for some of the cases in which I reach for Gatsby.
items.content_text: Started experimenting with rebuilding my personal website (untouched through the COVID era) with [Astro](https://astro.build/). Already excited to see much better it could be for some of the cases in which I reach for Gatsby.

items.content_html: My Jadeite keycaps have arrived after about 18 months of waiting, finally completing my COVID-extended build of the wireless Keychron K6 I use with my iPad.
items.content_text: My Jadeite keycaps have arrived after about 18 months of waiting, finally completing my COVID-extended build of the wireless Keychron K6 I use with my iPad.

items.content_html: All Night Radio was absolutely one of my favorite SXSW live surprises (and records) of the early aughts. Raven Sings the Blues has a nice writeup on the occasion of a small reissue.
items.content_text: All Night Radio was absolutely one of my favorite SXSW live surprises (and records) of the early aughts. Raven Sings the Blues has a [nice writeup](https://www.ravensingstheblues.com/all-night-radio-spirit-stereo-frequency/) on the occasion of a small reissue.

items.content_html: “The Desert Is Paper Thin” by Corntuth is countrified ambient and probably my favorite thing I picked up on the last Bandcamp Friday. Now there’s a crowdfund campaign for a vinyl release.
items.content_text: “The Desert Is Paper Thin” by Corntuth is countrified ambient and probably my favorite thing I picked up on the last Bandcamp Friday. Now there’s a [crowdfund campaign for a vinyl release](https://corntuth.bandcamp.com/campaign/the-desert-is-paper-thin).

items.content_html: Last morning run in the Kempen for the summer before heading back to Ohio for the school year.
items.content_text: Last morning run in the Kempen for the summer before heading back to Ohio for the school year.

items.content_html: Sunday morning long run for 16 miles through the Flemish farmland followed by some Dutch-Tex-Mex smoked mackerel and egg breakfast tacos on homemade tortillas (which I’d intended to photograph, but forgot).
items.content_text: Sunday morning long run for 16 miles through the Flemish farmland followed by some Dutch-Tex-Mex smoked mackerel and egg breakfast tacos on homemade tortillas (which I’d intended to photograph, but forgot).

items.content_text: Worked out a new run to Gierle and back this morning

items.content_html: Ran into some early-20s dudes walking back from town to their campsite while finishing up my sunrise run this morning. Got challenged to some head-to-head sprints. Beat all of them. Good signs for starting my proper marathon training regimen this week.
items.content_text: Ran into some early-20s dudes walking back from town to their campsite while finishing up my sunrise run this morning. Got challenged to some head-to-head sprints. Beat all of them. Good signs for starting my proper marathon training regimen this week.

items.content_html: Excited about the new Notes feature in BBEdit 14. The three things I use BBEdit for are opening multi-MB text files anything else would choke on, testing regex with Pattern Playgrounds, and opening dozens of ephemeral text files I never intend to save.
items.content_text: Excited about the new [Notes](https://www.barebones.com/products/bbedit/bbedit14.html) feature in BBEdit 14. The three things I use BBEdit for are opening multi-MB text files anything else would choke on, testing regex with Pattern Playgrounds, and opening dozens of ephemeral text files I never intend to save.

items.content_html: Our 2020 installment on Local Memory, a public history project on music in Austin, is The Wild Side of Life: The Rise of the Honky Tonks, 1940-1950
items.content_text: Our 2020 installment on Local Memory, a public history project on music in Austin, is [The Wild Side of Life: The Rise of the Honky Tonks, 1940-1950](https://local-memory.org/the-rise-of-the-honky-tonks)

items.content_html: Wild to see Khruangbin really breaking out. Good Houston.
items.content_text: Wild to see Khruangbin really [breaking out](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/15/arts/music/khruangbin-mordechai.html). Good Houston.

items.content_html: Thankful to take my son to see the protestors on High St. to give him something real in which to ground our conversations about this. Sorry it hasn’t felt safe to participate more. Hoping for justice for killer cops and peace for our Black neighbors.
items.content_text: Thankful to take my son to see the protestors on High St. to give him something real in which to ground our conversations about this. Sorry it hasn’t felt safe to participate more. Hoping for justice for killer cops and peace for our Black neighbors.

items.content_html: More than 17% of the Wikipedia entry on PrimeCo, once the largest wireless phone service in the U.S., addresses itself to the line “switched from Motorola to a PrimeCo phone” in Lil’ Troy’s “Wanna Be a Baller.” As it should.
items.content_text: More than 17% of the [Wikipedia entry on PrimeCo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PrimeCo), once the largest wireless phone service in the U.S., addresses itself to the line “switched from Motorola to a PrimeCo phone” in Lil’ Troy’s “Wanna Be a Baller.” As it should.

items.content_html: The Backlist archive is just small enough to make dead-stupid hand-formatted HTML (with some light automated templating) the simplest way to build it out. Old-fashioned and soothing.
items.content_text: The Backlist archive is just small enough to make dead-stupid hand-formatted HTML (with some light automated templating) the simplest way to build it out. Old-fashioned and soothing.

items.content_text: Confronting mortality by finally cataloging and organizing all of the books I will never have time to read on the basement bookshelves.

items.content_html: Very happy that I don’t have to choose between voting and potentially bringing the infection into my house with my kid today. Also nervous about the potential for this precedent to be abused in the general election.
items.content_text: Very happy that I don’t have to choose between voting and potentially bringing the infection into my house with my kid today. Also nervous about the potential for this precedent to be abused in the general election.

items.content_html: I have a lot of Astral Spirits stuff. A lot of diverse, compelling material and great art direction on the packaging. Good Austin.

items.content_html: Binned Art is an interesting concept: anonymous sales allow artists to recoup costs and clear space while providing the opportunity to own original artworks to a broader audience.
items.content_text: [Binned Art](https://binnedart.com/) is an interesting concept: anonymous sales allow artists to recoup costs and clear space while providing the opportunity to own original artworks to a broader audience.

items.content_html:
I miss the in-store bakery flour tortillas from H-E-B so much. (My homemade ones are only a little better, but/and so much more work…)

Honorable mention to in-store bakery corn tortillas from Fiesta.
items.content_text:
I miss the in-store bakery [flour tortillas from H-E-B](https://www.bonappetit.com/story/heb-flour-tortillas) so much. (My homemade ones are only a little better, but/and so much more work…)

Honorable mention to in-store bakery corn tortillas from Fiesta.

items.content_html: Austin Kleon on using your books as time capsules. I try to do a similar thing by using postcards, ticket stubs, restaurant cards, etc. as bookmarks and leaving them in the book when I finish.
items.content_text: Austin Kleon on using your books as [time capsules](https://austinkleon.com/2020/01/29/how-to-turn-your-books-into-time-capsules/). I try to do a similar thing by using postcards, ticket stubs, restaurant cards, etc. as bookmarks and leaving them in the book when I finish.

items.content_html: Michael found some Billboard magazine surveys that show UT-Austin as one of the most active destinations nationally for big band touring in the Swing era.
items.content_text: Michael found some [Billboard magazine surveys](https://local-memory.org/notes/music-hub-ut/) that show UT-Austin as one of the most active destinations nationally for big band touring in the Swing era.

items.content_html:
Sahel Sounds will be releasing an EP each month in 2020 for a “Music from Saharan WhatsApp” series. Each one will be recorded on a cellphone and transmitted over WhatsApp to be available on Bandcamp for one month.

The first installment is from Agadez guitar band Etran de L’Aïr.
items.content_text:
Sahel Sounds will be releasing an EP each month in 2020 for a “Music from Saharan WhatsApp” series. Each one will be recorded on a cellphone and transmitted over WhatsApp to be available on Bandcamp for one month.

The [first installment](https://etrandelair.bandcamp.com/) is from Agadez guitar band Etran de L’Aïr.

items.content_html: Interesting recent episode of Afropop Worldwide on the power dynamics involved in vinyl reissues of African music, particularly on the way that Western tastes shape what has been saved.
items.content_text: [Interesting recent episode](https://afropop.org/audio-programs/reissued-african-vinyl-in-the-21st-century) of Afropop Worldwide on the power dynamics involved in vinyl reissues of African music, particularly on the way that Western tastes shape what has been saved.

items.content_html: Some of the “outsider pedal steel” referenced here is new to me and I’m interested to check it out. Drag that Ricky wasn’t named and given credit for a broader influence across the Phosphorescent output. Also, don’t sleep on Gary Newcomb playing with Lil’ Cap’n Travis.
items.content_text: Some of the “outsider pedal steel” [referenced here](https://www.npr.org/2020/01/07/793989801/the-endless-potential-of-the-pedal-steel-guitar-an-odd-duck-by-any-measure) is new to me and I’m interested to check it out. Drag that Ricky wasn’t named and given credit for a broader influence across the Phosphorescent output. Also, don’t sleep on Gary Newcomb playing with Lil’ Cap’n Travis.

items.content_html:
Looking forward to get the hardcopy of Issue #0 of new code::art journal.

PDF version is freely downloadable, and there’s some interesting stuff in here.
items.content_text:

items.content_html: We brought this guy, Antonio, home yesterday to start the new year.
items.content_text: We brought this guy, Antonio, home yesterday to start the new year.

items.content_html: I love this colorful installation of felt pieces by Masako Miki. I would love to learn how to felt things; I’d like to understand how to exert a little control over the magic that goes on between the initial construction and the felted product.
items.content_text: I love this colorful installation of felt pieces by [Masako Miki](http://www.masakomiki.com/2019-03.html). I would love to learn how to felt things; I’d like to understand how to exert a little control over the magic that goes on between the initial construction and the felted product.

items.content_html: When trying out a Chromebook a few years ago, I remember being impressed by the Markdown editor Caret, but more as a parlor trick than a reliable tool. Revisiting it at version 4.0, and it has come a very long way.
items.content_text: When trying out a Chromebook a few years ago, I remember being impressed by the Markdown editor [Caret](https://caret.io/), but more as a parlor trick than a reliable tool. Revisiting it at version 4.0, and it has come a very long way.

items.content_html: I miss Phinery tapes. Always simple, beautiful packaging. Writing documentation and listening to this 2017 Vales release.
items.content_text: I miss Phinery tapes. Always simple, beautiful packaging. Writing documentation and listening to [this 2017 Vales release](https://phinery.bandcamp.com/album/tile).

items.content_html: Pre-sunrise, post-rain frog song coming in through the window over the heavy drones from this Luciernaga/John Lindaman split from Oxtail Recordings.

items.content_html: Every time I revisit Ernest Haeckel’s natural illustrations I get into a different set of his palettes. This is my current favorite.
items.content_text: Every time I revisit Ernest Haeckel’s [natural illustrations](https://publicdomainreview.org/collections/ernst-haeckels-jellyfish/) I get into a different set of his palettes. This is my current favorite.

items.content_html: Cool use of double-paned glass: lettering on front pane with brushed backdrop on back pane creates depth effect.
items.content_text: Cool use of double-paned glass: lettering on front pane with brushed backdrop on back pane creates depth effect.

items.content_html: I’m pretty happy with these updated presentations on our pieces connecting national touring bands to Austin and UT in the 1930s.
items.content_text: I’m pretty happy with these [updated presentations](https://local-memory.org/notes/national-bands-in-austin/) on our pieces connecting national touring bands to Austin and UT in the 1930s.

items.content_html: I’ll jump on anything about Sail Away or Good Old Boys, and this episode of Malcolm Gladwell’s podcast gets into both. I am used to Gladwell answering his own questions emphatically. I think he thinks he answers his question here, if less emphatically. I’m not sure he does.
items.content_text: I’ll jump on anything about _Sail Away_ or _Good Old Boys_, and [this episode](http://revisionisthistory.com/episodes/34-good-old-boys) of Malcolm Gladwell’s podcast gets into both. I am used to Gladwell answering his own questions emphatically. I think he thinks he answers his question here, if less emphatically. I’m not sure he does.

items.content_html: Glitch in VS Code is exciting. The online editor is impressive, but I‘ll be even more likely to use Glitch as a sandbox for experiments if I can use my normal tools.
items.content_text: [Glitch in VS Code](https://culture-zine.glitch.me/culture/announcing-glitch-for-visual-studio-code/) is exciting. The online editor is impressive, but I‘ll be even more likely to use Glitch as a sandbox for experiments if I can use my normal tools.

items.content_html: Sunrise run in Savoy
items.content_text: Sunrise run in Savoy

items.content_html: Posted an interview with the late Alvin Fielder, a founding member of the Association for the Advancement of Creative Musicians, about his time as a student at Texas Southern in 1950s Houston and the influence of R&B on jazz.
items.content_text: Posted an [interview with the late Alvin Fielder](https://local-memory.org/notes/interview-with-alvin-fielder/), a founding member of the Association for the Advancement of Creative Musicians, about his time as a student at Texas Southern in 1950s Houston and the influence of R&B on jazz.

items.content_html: Juneteenth seems like a good time to link to these excerpts of Gene Ramey’s recollections of music performance in East Austin in the early twentieth century.
items.content_text: Juneteenth seems like a good time to [link to](https://local-memory.org/athens-on-the-colorado/narratives/gene-ramey) these excerpts of Gene Ramey’s recollections of music performance in East Austin in the early twentieth century.

items.content_html:
“The question we need to ask is not whether our data is safe, but why there is suddenly so much of it that needs protecting. The problem with the dragon, after all, is not its stockpile stewardship, but its appetite.”

https://idlewords.com/2019/06/the_new_wilderness.htm
items.content_text:

items.content_html: We’ve published several updates and a couple of new essays to the Athens on the Colorado exhibit on Local Memory, our website on the history of music in Austin
items.content_text: We’ve published several updates and a couple of new essays to the [Athens on the Colorado](https://local-memory.org/notes/east-austin-swing-and-other-updates/) exhibit on Local Memory, our website on the history of music in Austin

items.content_html: The mid-year fundraiser for Public Domain Review ends Wednesday. Under 100 new supporters to reach the goal.
items.content_text: The [mid-year fundraiser](https://publicdomainreview.org/support/) for Public Domain Review ends Wednesday. Under 100 new supporters to reach the goal.

items.content_html: Rhein-Ruhr-Marathon starting line in Duisburg for my last European marathon for our year in Gent and fourth of four in two months.
items.content_text: Rhein-Ruhr-Marathon starting line in Duisburg for my last European marathon for our year in Gent and fourth of four in two months.

items.content_html: At an early dinner on the Innenhafen and amazed at how little Duisburg has changed in the six years since we lived here.
items.content_text: At an early dinner on the Innenhafen and amazed at how little Duisburg has changed in the six years since we lived here.

items.content_html: The inclusion of tick repellent spray in my participant pack for the Rhein-Ruhr-Marathon is not comforting.
items.content_text: The inclusion of tick repellent spray in my participant pack for the Rhein-Ruhr-Marathon is not comforting.

items.content_html: Woke up to the news that Roky Erickson had died. So much of my lifelong interest in seeking out challenging music can be traced back to memories of listening to Elevators records while doing the dishes with my dad as a kid.
items.content_text: Woke up to the news that [Roky Erickson had died](https://www.austinchronicle.com/daily/music/2019-05-31/roky-erickson-ascends-to-the-13th-floor-1947-2019/). So much of my lifelong interest in seeking out challenging music can be traced back to memories of listening to Elevators records while doing the dishes with my dad as a kid.

items.content_html: 1960s/1970s single-artwork or single-series spaces (e.g., Rothko Chapel) is probably my favorite architectural micro-genre. Tongerlo Abbey’s museum for their period Last Supper replica is very nice.
items.content_text: 1960s/1970s single-artwork or single-series spaces (e.g., Rothko Chapel) is probably my favorite architectural micro-genre. [Tongerlo Abbey’s](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tongerlo_Abbey) museum for their period Last Supper replica is very nice.

items.content_html: This episode of the Time to Eat the Dogs podcast on space science and the Arab world presented some interesting insights on the periodization of the history of science in the the Muslim world.
items.content_text: This [episode](https://timetoeatthedogs.com/2019/05/27/space-science-and-the-arab-world/) of the Time to Eat the Dogs podcast on space science and the Arab world presented some interesting insights on the periodization of the history of science in the the Muslim world.

items.content_html: One of my surprise favorite tour nights was one of the dates we did with them at a tiny basement show under a Wendy’s in State College, PA and watching them play a super-extended ”Fields in Glass.”
items.content_text: One of my surprise favorite tour nights was one of the dates we did with them at a tiny basement show under a Wendy’s in State College, PA and watching them play a super-extended ”[Fields in Glass](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=daZHb6z5PQs).”

items.content_html: Listening to the High Dials‘ War of the Wakening Phantoms (with opening banger “Holy Ground”) for the first time in a long time. Stoked they have something new coming out this summer.
items.content_text: Listening to the High Dials‘ _War of the Wakening Phantoms_ (with opening banger “[Holy Ground](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EeQOOzAtLLg)”) for the first time in a long time. Stoked they have something new coming out this summer.

items.content_html: I love this Paul Ford essay in WIRED on remaining enthusiastic about technology in its hegemonic phase (and still wish I’d asked to join tilde.club while I watched him spinning it up on Twitter).
items.content_text: I love this Paul Ford essay in WIRED on [remaining enthusiastic about technology](https://www.wired.com/story/why-we-love-tech-defense-difficult-industry/) in its hegemonic phase (and still wish I’d asked to join tilde.club while I watched him spinning it up on Twitter).

items.content_html: Finally broke through a long plateau with a 5 minute improvement on my personal best. The right marathon for celebrating.
items.content_text: Finally broke through a long plateau with a 5 minute improvement on my personal best. The right marathon for celebrating.

items.content_html: Will‘s “Crazy Love” album from last year has me missing being in Austin.
items.content_text: Will‘s “[Crazy Love](https://willcourtneymusic.com/album/869301/crazy-love-full-resolution)” album from last year has me missing being in Austin.

items.content_html: In addition to being a GOAT track title candidate, “Jajouka Pipe Dream” is an exceptional spacey blend of synths, flutes, and percussion from Ghazi Barakat and Paul LeBrecque. The other side has more of LeBrecque‘s guitar, and is great as well.
items.content_text: In addition to being a GOAT track title candidate, “[Jajouka Pipe Dream](https://karlrecords.bandcamp.com/track/jajouka-pipe-dream)” is an exceptional spacey blend of synths, flutes, and percussion from Ghazi Barakat and Paul LeBrecque. The other side has more of LeBrecque‘s guitar, and is great as well.

items.content_html: I’m finally listening to the new Mdou Moctar and it has been well worth the wait. The vinyl is waiting for me when we get back to the States at the end of the summer.
items.content_text: I’m finally listening to the [new Mdou Moctar](https://www.popmatters.com/mdou-moctar-ilana-the-creator-2632239582.html) and it has been well worth the wait. The vinyl is waiting for me when we get back to the States at the end of the summer.

items.content_text: I’m always trying to be [too clever for a database](https://tinaja.computer/2019/03/28/just-use-a-database.html).

items.content_html: Doing a “CD-Rs I was given while packing the trailer in college town parking lots between 2004-2007” listening session today. Clear winner is Art Lessing from Davis, CA with strong Jandek vibes.
items.content_text: Doing a “CD-Rs I was given while packing the trailer in college town parking lots between 2004-2007” listening session today. Clear winner is [Art Lessing](https://www.discogs.com/artist/641979-Art-Lessing) from Davis, CA with strong Jandek vibes.

items.content_text: Revisiting the Gorilla Vs. Bear [Austin Mixtape](http://www.gorillavsbear.net/gorilla-vs-bears-austin-mixtape/) from 2006. Good era.

items.content_html: The last time I spent a really silly amount of time wondering why a CSS rule wasn‘t being applied because I had forgotten I needed to interpolate my Sass variables inside of calc(), I wrote this blog post about it so I wouldn‘t forget again. Didn’t work.
items.content_text: The last time I spent a really silly amount of time wondering why a CSS rule wasn‘t being applied because I had forgotten I needed to interpolate my Sass variables inside of calc(), I wrote [this blog post](https://tinaja.computer/2017/12/02/sass-interpolation.html) about it so I wouldn‘t forget again. Didn’t work.

items.content_html: Need to get back in a Python frame of mind. Spent 10 minutes starting to write a slap-dash CSV parser before it occurred to me to import csv…
items.content_text: Need to get back in a Python frame of mind. Spent 10 minutes starting to write a slap-dash CSV parser before it occurred to me to `import csv`…

items.content_html: Ordered a set of three Rabit screw tapes off Boomkat the other day. Listening to CRY ALONE DIE ALONE on Bandcamp while I wait. Great soundtrack for exploring 7500 row CSV files with Python.
items.content_text: Ordered a set of three Rabit screw tapes off Boomkat the other day. Listening to [CRY ALONE DIE ALONE](https://gangstalkers.bandcamp.com/track/full-mixx) on Bandcamp while I wait. Great soundtrack for exploring 7500 row CSV files with Python.

items.content_html: Listening to “Our Love Will Change the World” and dwelling one more time on Matthew Smith‘s founding role in not one but two under-appreciated great bands in Outrageous Cherry and the Volebeats.
items.content_text: Listening to “[Our Love Will Change the World](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_R8j9D8mcXg)” and dwelling one more time on Matthew Smith‘s founding role in not one but two under-appreciated great bands in Outrageous Cherry and the Volebeats.

items.content_html: “Again, a less confusing solution would have been to just allow an extra argument to be passed to exec, but confusion is an essential feature of JavaScript’s regular expression interface.” From Marijn Haverbeke’s Eloquent JavaScript

items.content_html:
The Mellotron is right up my alley in its inherent tension between mechanized reproducibility and analog serendipity.

An impromptu recording of “Boat Song” with a real Mellotron one late night in L.A. remains one of my favorite touring memories.
items.content_text:
The [Mellotron](http://www.openculture.com/2018/12/introducing-the-mellotron.html) is right up my alley in its inherent tension between mechanized reproducibility and analog serendipity.

An impromptu recording of “Boat Song” with a real Mellotron one late night in L.A. remains one of my favorite touring memories.

items.content_html: The Public Domain Review is doing their end-of-year fundraiser. It’s a great resource, and if you sign up in time, you’ll get a thematic set of postcards. I’ve helped with a couple rounds of reward fulfillments in the past and can vouch for the effort and care that Adam puts into the project.
items.content_text: The Public Domain Review is doing their [end-of-year fundraiser](https://publicdomainreview.org/support/). It’s a great resource, and if you sign up in time, you’ll get a thematic set of postcards. I’ve helped with a couple rounds of reward fulfillments in the past and can vouch for the effort and care that Adam puts into the project.

items.content_html: I would love to try to recreate how Hiva Alizadeh layers these threads in ways that work both sculpturally and as images.
items.content_text: I would love to try to recreate how [Hiva Alizadeh](http://www.shiringallery.com/exhibitions/scenery-play) layers these threads in ways that work both sculpturally and as images.

items.content_html: 🎙️ Just listened to the first episode of the Artist in the Archive podcast with Jer Thorp, currently ‘innovator-in-residence’ at Library of Congress. Looking forward to catching up on the rest of the catalog.
items.content_text: 🎙️ Just listened to the first episode of the [Artist in the Archive podcast](https://artistinthearchive.podbean.com/e/episode-1-in-the-house-of-avram/) with Jer Thorp, currently ‘innovator-in-residence’ at Library of Congress. Looking forward to catching up on the rest of the catalog.

items.content_html: I’ve been using SourceNote for a couple of days now and have found it helpful. It’s invisible until you need it. Great low friction way to save ephemeral or scratch text without losing momentum in your work.
items.content_text: I’ve been using [SourceNote](https://www.sourcenoteapp.com/) for a couple of days now and have found it helpful. It’s invisible until you need it. Great low friction way to save ephemeral or scratch text without losing momentum in your work.

items.content_html: I’ve been using MarsEdit as a drafts drawer for microblogging posts—a place to drop links to things I’d like to post later. It has me posting more things that I’d otherwise forget to return to.
items.content_text: I’ve been using [MarsEdit](https://red-sweater.com/marsedit/) as a drafts drawer for microblogging posts—a place to drop links to things I’d like to post later. It has me posting more things that I’d otherwise forget to return to.

items.content_text:

I wish the PDF downloads were OCR’ed, but at least the Google Books editions are searchable.

items.content_html: Some New Cities is my new favorite Twitter bot, but it also makes me realize I increasingly wish I could follow these things on the fediverse or via RSS instead of on Twitter.
items.content_text: [Some New Cities](https://twitter.com/some_new_cities) is my new favorite Twitter bot, but it also makes me realize I increasingly wish I could follow these things on the fediverse or via RSS instead of on Twitter.

items.content_html:
Kasterlee Marathon this morning will be my second in three weeks. Will be mostly through the woods in mud and in the low 40s.

Killing time until the late start is the hardest part.
items.content_text:
Kasterlee Marathon this morning will be my second in three weeks. Will be mostly through the woods in mud and in the low 40s.

Killing time until the late start is the hardest part.

items.content_html: I wish this interview with Mat Dryhurst deeper on the power crypto could artists to control their creative assets but I‘m intrigued to follow up on his work more elsewhere.
items.content_text: I wish [this interview](https://breakermag.com/mat-dryhurst-musician-iconoclast-on-helping-artists-with-blockchain/) with Mat Dryhurst deeper on the power crypto could artists to control their creative assets but I‘m intrigued to follow up on his work more elsewhere.

items.content_html: Nice concept: Website for Emily Cockayne‘s upcoming history of re-use collects essays on material that didn’t make the book (good use of the .work TLD as well) www.rummage.work

items.content_html: I had not considered the idea that Rockstar‘s corpus is largely historical, but Robert Whitaker’s exploration for Eurogamer is interesting.
items.content_text: I had not considered the idea that Rockstar‘s corpus is largely historical, but Robert Whitaker’s [exploration](https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-11-05-rockstars-history-of-america) for Eurogamer is interesting.
